required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Special Investigation Of Genotropin Long Follow-Up For Patients With A Small For Gestational Age "Scoped for Japanese"
clinical_study.official_title: AN INVESTIGATION INTENDED TO EVALUATE THE LONG-TERM EFFICACY AND SAFETY OF GENOTROPIN IN CHILDREN WITH SGA DWARFISM WITHOUT EPIPHYSEAL CLOSURE. (RETROSPECTIVE STUDY)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this surveillance is to collect Safety and Effectiveness information for Long term Use of Somatropin for Patients with a Small for Gestational Age (SGA).

detailed_description.textblock: All the patients whom an investigator prescribes Genotropin should be registered consecutively until the number of subjects reaches target number in order to extract patients enrolled into the investigation at random.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reaction (ADR)
primary_outcome.description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to Genotropin in a participant who received Genotropin. A serious ADR (SADR) was an ADR resulting in any of the following out comes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Relatedness to Genotropin was assessed by the physician.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Height Velocity Standard Deviation (SD) Score for Chronological Age From Baseline At Year 1
primary_outcome.description: Change in height Velocity SD score from baseline was calculated. Height Velocity SD score = (Height - Standard height for chronological age of gender) / SD. An SD score indicates how far a participant's score deviates from the mean of the reference population; an SD score higher than the mean gives a positive SD score whereas an SD score lower than the mean gives a negative SD score. SD score indicates how similar participant was to reference population.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Height Velocity Standard Deviation (SD) Score for Chronological Age From Baseline at Year 2
primary_outcome.description: Change in height Velocity SD score from baseline was calculated. Height Velocity SD score = (Height - Standard height for chronological age of gender) / SD. An SD score indicates how far a participant's score deviates from the mean of the reference population; an SD score higher than the mean gives a positive SD score whereas an SD score lower than the mean gives a negative SD score. SD score indicates how similar participant was to reference population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Height Standard Deviation (SD) Score at Puberty and at Near Final Height in Participants Who Reached Near Final Height
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, At Puberty, At Near Final Height within the span of approximately maximum of 11.58 years
secondary_outcome.description: Height SD score = (Height - Standard height for chronological age of gender) / SD. An SD score indicates how far a participant's score deviates from the mean of the reference population; an SD score higher than the mean gives a positive SD score whereas an SD score lower than the mean gives a negative SD score. SD score indicates how similar participant was to reference population. Near final height was defined as the height at one of the following conditions: the annual height velocity became less than 2 cm/year after reaching the maximum height in puberty, bone age reached 17 years old and older for male and 15 years old and older for female, or the reason for discontinuation was that subject reached the near final height or had epiphyseal closure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Height Standard Deviation (SD) Score at Puberty and at Near Final Height in Participants Who Reached Near Final Height From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, At Puberty, At Near Final Height within the span of approximately maximum of 11.58 years
secondary_outcome.description: Change in height SD score from baseline was calculated. Height SD score = (Height - Standard height for chronological age of gender) / SD. An SD score indicates how far a participant's score deviates from the mean of the reference population; an SD score higher than the mean gives a positive SD score whereas an SD score lower than the mean gives a negative SD score. SD score indicates how similar participant was to reference population. Near final height was defined as the height at one of the following conditions: the annual height velocity became less than 2 cm/year after reaching the maximum height in puberty, bone age reached 17 years old and older for male and 15 years old and older for female, or the reason for discontinuation was that subject reached the near final height or had epiphyseal closure.

study_pop.textblock:
- A patients who is diagnosed for SGA. (SGA is defined as birth weight and/or length at least 2 standard deviations (SDs) below the mean for gestational age (<or=-2 SD)).
- A patient who is SGA and older than 3 years.
- A patient who has persistent short stature (i.e., remaining at least 2.5 SD below the mean for chronologic age).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A patient who was administered Somatropin (Genotropin).
Exclusion Criteria:
- N/A.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: It is a retrospective study. Data was collected for participants from July 2005 - February 2017(approximately over 11 years 6 months).

group.title: Genotropin [Somatropin (Genetical Recombination)]
group.description: Participants who received Genotropin treatment in a real world clinic setting as prescribed in clinical practice from July 2005 - February 2017. Data was observed retrospectively.

group.title: Genotropin [Somatropin (Genetical Recombination)]
group.description: Participants who received Genotropin treatment in a real world clinic setting as prescribed in clinical practice from July 2005 - February 2017. Data was observed retrospectively.

measure.title: Age, Customized
Sex/Gender, Customized
Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reaction (ADR)
outcome.description: An adverse drug reaction (ADR) was any untoward medical occurrence attributed to Genotropin in a participant who received Genotropin. A serious ADR (SADR) was an ADR resulting in any of the following out comes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Relatedness to Genotropin was assessed by the physician.
outcome.population: The safety analysis set comprised of participants who satisfied the inclusion criteria and had received Genotropin.

outcome.population: The efficacy analysis set comprised of participants in the safety analysis set who had effectiveness evaluation at least once. Here "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" signifies participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

group.description: Participants who received Genotropin treatment in a real world clinic setting as prescribed in clinical practice from July 2005 - February 2017. Data was observed retrospectively.

measure.title: Change in Height Standard Deviation (SD) Score for Chronological Age From Baseline at Year 3
measure.description: Change in height SD score from baseline was calculated. Height SD score = (Height - Standard height for chronological age of gender) / SD. An SD score indicates how far a participant's score deviates from the mean of the reference population; an SD score higher than the mean gives a positive SD score whereas an SD score lower than the mean gives a negative SD score. SD score indicates how similar participant was to reference population.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis set comprised of participants in the safety analysis set who had effectiveness evaluation at least once. Here "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" signifies participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

measurement_list.measurement: Only 1 subject evaluable hence standard deviation could not be estimated.

measure.title: Change in Height Standard Deviation (SD) Score for Chronological Age From Baseline at Year 10
measure.description: Change in height SD score from baseline was calculated. Height SD score = (Height - Standard height for chronological age of gender) / SD. An SD score indicates how far a participant's score deviates from the mean of the reference population; an SD score higher than the mean gives a positive SD score whereas an SD score lower than the mean gives a negative SD score. measurement_list.measurement: Only 1 subject evaluable hence standard deviation could not be estimated.

outcome.title: Height Standard Deviation (SD) Score at Puberty and at Near Final Height in Participants Who Reached Near Final Height
outcome.description: Height SD score = (Height - Standard height for chronological age of gender) / SD. An SD score indicates how far a participant's score deviates from the mean of the reference population; an SD score higher than the mean gives a positive SD score whereas an SD score lower than the mean gives a negative SD score. SD score indicates how similar participant was to reference population. Near final height was defined as the height at one of the following conditions: the annual height velocity became less than 2 cm/year after reaching the maximum height in puberty, bone age reached 17 years old and older for male and 15 years old and older for female, or the reason for discontinuation was that subject reached the near final height or had epiphyseal closure.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, At Puberty, At Near Final Height within the span of approximately maximum of 11.58 years
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis set comprised of participants in the safety analysis set who had effectiveness evaluation at least once. Among the efficacy analysis set, the participants who reached near final height was analyzed.

group.title: Genotropin [Somatropin (Genetical Recombination)]
group.description: Participants who received Genotropin treatment in a real world clinic setting as prescribed in clinical practice from July 2005 - February 2017. Data was observed retrospectively.

measure.title: Height Standard Deviation (SD) Score at Puberty and at Near Final Height in Participants Who Reached Near Final Height
measure.description: Height SD score = (Height - Standard height for chronological age of gender) / SD. Near final height was defined as the height at one of the following conditions: the annual height velocity became less than 2 cm/year after reaching the maximum height in puberty, bone age reached 17 years old and older for male and 15 years old and older for female, or the reason for discontinuation was that subject reached the near final height or had epiphyseal closure.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis set comprised of participants in the safety analysis set who had effectiveness evaluation at least once. Among the efficacy analysis set, the participants who reached near final height was analyzed.

outcome.title: Change in Height Standard Deviation (SD) Score at Puberty and at Near Final Height in Participants Who Reached Near Final Height From Baseline
outcome.description: Change in height SD score from baseline was calculated. Height SD score = (Height - Standard height for chronological age of gender) / SD. An SD score indicates how far a participant's score deviates from the mean of the reference population; an SD score higher than the mean gives a positive SD score whereas an SD score lower than the mean gives a negative SD score. SD score indicates how similar participant was to reference population. Near final height was defined as the height at one of the following conditions: the annual height velocity became less than 2 cm/year after reaching the maximum height in puberty, bone age reached 17 years old and older for male and 15 years old and older for female, or the reason for discontinuation was that subject reached the near final height or had epiphyseal closure.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, At Puberty, At Near Final Height within the span of approximately maximum of 11.58 years
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis set comprised of participants in the safety analysis set who had effectiveness evaluation at least once. Among the efficacy analysis set, the participants who reached near final height was analyzed.

measure.description: Change in height SD score from baseline was calculated. Height SD score = (Height - Standard height for chronological age of gender) / SD. An SD score indicates how far a participant's score deviates from the mean of the reference population; an SD score higher than the mean gives a positive SD score whereas an SD score lower than the mean gives a negative SD score. Near final height was defined as the height at one of the following conditions: the annual height velocity became less than 2 cm/year after reaching the maximum height in puberty, bone age reached 17 years old and older for male and 15 years old and older for female, or the reason for discontinuation was that subject reached the near final height or had epiphyseal closure.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis set comprised of participants in the safety analysis set who had effectiveness evaluation at least once. Among the efficacy analysis set, the participants who reached near final height was analyzed.

reported_events.desc: The frequency of adverse events. The same event may appear as both an adverse event and a serious adverse event. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as non-serious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both serious and non-serious events during the study.

group.title: Genotropin [Somatropin (Genetical Recombination)]
group.description: Participants who received Genotropin treatment in a real world clinic setting as prescribed in clinical practice from July 2005 - February 2017. Data was observed retrospectively.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
